employer: University of Waterloo Aerial Robotics Group
description: Sourced an appropriate replaced regulator based on technical specifications and costs while managing a BOM of components
Developed schematic of regulator subsystem, along with designing an appropriate schematic symbol and footprint
Redesigned and routed existing PCB to fit new regulator and associated components
Wrote a driver for DS-25 Netzer Encoder in C++, implementing SPI communication and enabling direct memory access for asynchronous reads.
Developed a custom plugin on Ubuntu Linux to handle GPS data conversion and dispatching using C++ and rqt (Qt-based framework)
Gained extensive knowledge of Robot Operating System (ROS) and related concepts such as nodes, messages, topics and services
